paper.abstract: Abstract A process logic (PL) is defined that subsumes Prattu0027s process logic, Parikhu0027s SOAPL, Nishimurau0027s process logic, and Pnueliu0027s Temporal Logic in expressiveness. The language of PL is an extension of the language of Propositional Dynamic Logic (PDL). A deductive system for PL is given which includes the Segerberg axioms for PDL and it is proved that it is complete. It is also shown that PL is decidable.
